actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on April 19, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 404
actions-list.actionItem: 14 (Roll no. 141).
Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 1143 — "Condemning Iran's unprecedented drone and missile attack on Israel."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on agreeing H. Res. 1143 which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of April 18.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1143, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Kean demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule on the resolution and preamble.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1143.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 6323, H. Res. 1143, H.R. 4691, H.R. 5947, H.R. 6046 and H.R. 4639. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 6323, H. Res. 1143, H.R. 4691, H.R. 5947, and H.R. 6046 under a closed rule, and for consideration of H.R. 4639 under a structured rule. The resolution provides for one hour of debate on each measure and one motion to recommit on H.R. 6323, H.R. 4691, H.R. 5947, H.R. 6046, and H.R. 4639.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1149. H. Res. 1143 — "Condemning Iran's unprecedented drone and missile attack on Israel."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Gottheimer to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Pastor J. Heinrich Arnold, Bruderhof church communities, Rifton, New York
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
